thread.title: Paris goes car-free to highlight air pollution caused by traffic
thread.title_full: Paris goes car-free to highlight air pollution caused by traffic | DailyTelegraph

author: dailytelegraph.com
title: Paris goes car-free to highlight air pollution caused by traffic
text:
PRETTY but noisy Paris, its gracious Old World buildings blackened by exhaust fumes, went car-less for a day yesterday.
Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo presided over Sunday’s “day without cars,” two months before the city hosts the global summit on climate change.
The symbolic initiative is aimed at showing that air pollution from traffic — a prime source in Paris — must be reduced worldwide and capitals must take concrete measures to shrink their carbon footprint.
Thousands of people walk the usually choked Champs Elysees Avenue. AP Photo/Thibault Camus.
A woman rides a bicycle at Place de la Bastille during the "Car-Free Day" event. AFP PHOTO / BERTRAND GUAY.
Families take over the Champs Elysees Avenue. AP Photo/Thibault Camus.
People walk outside the Palais Garnier opera house during the "Car-Free Day". AFP PHOTO / BERTRAND GUAY.
Two men in front of the Eiffel Tower early in the morning before the “journey without cars”. AFP PHOTO / LUDOVIC MARIN.
A couple make the most of the car-free day. AFP PHOTO / FLORIAN DAVID
Velo Liberte 25:40 Paris' ambitious Velo Liberte bike initiative encourages residents to forgo cars for bikes and public transport. The programme has sparked a new culture, complete with its own language, jokes and pick-up lines.
